meanings.definition: To be located within the wheel of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The tiny pebble inwheels itself between the spokes of the bicycle wheel.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic warned not to inwheel any loose clothing near the car's tires.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel decided to inwheel itself into the spinning wheel of the toy car.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts inwheeled around the idea of traveling the world on a bicycle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the acrobat inwheeling through the giant wheel stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To become involved in a situation or activity.
meanings.sent1: She didn't want to inwheel in the argument between her friends.
meanings.sent2: The new student quickly inwheeled in the school's drama club.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to inwheel in the game of hide and seek with the children.
meanings.sent4: His mind started to inwheel in the exciting possibilities of the upcoming project.
meanings.sent5: The young detective inwheeled in the mystery of the missing cookies.
